page.title: 11RYTON TOWN FARM.
page.content: Town Farm is on Ryton village green. The farm has been there for hundreds of years. The present buildings date back to{1792}as seen on a weather vane. In the 18th century you were charged for having windows, so the farm blocked up six windows for tax reasons. They used to have pigs, working horses, dairy cows, sheep and poultry. The{stables}and{pig sties}are still there. There seems to have been no fields connected to the farm. The fields are near the{Willows}and the old pit. The vegetable garden is now a very small hay field. Recently they have grown only crops, barley, hay and potatoes.{The Granary,}where they stored the grain has been sold for conversion into a private house. Some of the fields have been sold and the future of the farm is unsure.
